intro: Diplotaxis saxatilis, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Diplotaxis saxatilis is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
